metadata.title: Nomad by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Nomad is a highly available, distributed, data-center aware cluster and application scheduler designed to support the modern datacenter with support for long-running services, batch jobs, and much more.

alertBanner.text: Our community conference is taking place in San Francisco and online October 10-12.

integrationsConfig.description: A curated collection of official, partner, and community Nomad Integrations.

integrations.name: Pledge Task Driver
integrations.description: The Pledge task driver uses Landlock LSM and SECCOMP BPF to sandbox commands. It is a more secure alternative to using raw_exec for privileged operations.

integration_type.name: Task Driver
integration_type.description: Task drivers are used by Nomad clients to execute a task and provide resource isolation.

integrations.description: The open source Capture The Flag framework for hiring, training, and teaching hackers

integration_type.name: Pack
integration_type.description: Packs are templated sets of resources that are meant to be deployed to Nomad together. Each pack defines parameters that can be customized by the end user.

integrations.name: Grafana Tempo
integrations.description: Grafana Tempo is an open source, easy-to-use and high-scale distributed tracing backend. Tempo is cost-efficient, requiring only object storage to operate, and is deeply integrated with Grafana, Prometheus, and Loki. Tempo can be used with any of the open source tracing protocols, including Jaeger, Zipkin, and OpenTelemetry.

integrations.name: Alertmanager
integrations.description: The Alertmanager handles alerts sent by client applications such as the Prometheus server. It takes care of deduplicating, grouping, and routing them to the correct receiver integrations such as email, PagerDuty, or OpsGenie. It also takes care of silencing and inhibition of alerts.

integration_type.name: Pack
integration_type.description: Packs are templated sets of resources that are meant to be deployed to Nomad together. Each pack defines parameters that can be customized by the end user.

integrations.name: Lightrun Driver
integrations.description: The Lightrun Nomad driver is used to execute Java applications packaged into a Java Jar file and automatically add the Lightrun agent to them.

integration_type.name: Task Driver
integration_type.description: Task drivers are used by Nomad clients to execute a task and provide resource isolation.

integrations.name: Nomad DigitalOcean Droplets Autoscaler
integrations.description: The do-droplets target plugin allows for the scaling of the Nomad cluster clients via creating and destroying DigitalOcean Droplets.

integration_type.name: Autoscaler Target
integration_type.description: Target plugins determine where the resource to be autoscaled is located and execute the scaling actions determined by the Autoscaler. The target can be a Nomad job group (horizontal application scaling), the number of Nomad clients (horizontal cluster scaling), or the amount of resources assigned to a Nomad task (vertical application scaling).

integrations.name: Nomad Openstack Nova Autoscaler
integrations.description: The os-nova Nomad autoscaler target plugin allows for the scaling of Nomad clients by creating and deleting Openstack Nova Compute instances.

integration_type.name: Autoscaler Target
integration_type.description: Target plugins determine where the resource to be autoscaled is located and execute the scaling actions determined by the Autoscaler. The target can be a Nomad job group (horizontal application scaling), the number of Nomad clients (horizontal cluster scaling), or the amount of resources assigned to a Nomad task (vertical application scaling).

integrations.name: Singularity Driver
integrations.description: The Singularity driver provides an interface for using Singularity for running application containers.

integration_type.name: Task Driver
integration_type.description: Task drivers are used by Nomad clients to execute a task and provide resource isolation.

integrations.name: Threshold Strategy Plugin
integrations.description: The threshold strategy defines a range of metric values with a lower and an upper bound, and an action to take when the current metric value is considered to be within bounds.

integration_type.name: Autoscaler Strategy
integration_type.description: Strategy plugins compare the current state of the system against the desired state defined by the operator in a scaling policy. In practical terms, strategies receive the current value and a metric value for a resource and output what the new value should be.

integrations.name: Target Value Strategy Plugin
integrations.description: The target-value strategy plugin performs count calculations in order to keep the value resulting from the APM query at or around a specified target.

integration_type.name: Autoscaler Strategy
integration_type.description: Strategy plugins compare the current state of the system against the desired state defined by the operator in a scaling policy. In practical terms, strategies receive the current value and a metric value for a resource and output what the new value should be.

integrations.name: Raw Fork/Exec Driver
integrations.description: The raw_exec driver is used to execute a command for a task without any isolation.

integration_type.name: Task Driver
integration_type.description: Task drivers are used by Nomad clients to execute a task and provide resource isolation.

integrations.name: QEMU Driver
integrations.description: The qemu driver provides a generic virtual machine runner.

integration_type.name: Task Driver
integration_type.description: Task drivers are used by Nomad clients to execute a task and provide resource isolation.

integrations.name: Prometheus APM Plugin
integrations.description: The prometheus APM plugin allows querying for metrics stored in a Prometheus server.

integration_type.name: Autoscaler APM Plugin
integration_type.description: Application Performance Management (APM) tools are used to store metrics about an applications performance and its current state. APM plugins are responsible for querying an APM and returning a time series which will be used to determine if scaling should occur.

integrations.name: Podman Task Driver
integrations.description: The Podman task driver plugin for Nomad uses the Pod Manager (podman) daemonless container runtime for executing Nomad tasks.

integration_type.name: Task Driver
integration_type.description: Task drivers are used by Nomad clients to execute a task and provide resource isolation.

integrations.name: Pass-Through Strategy Plugin
integrations.description: The pass-through strategy is a very simple, yet useful strategy. It does not add any extra computation on top of the metric query result, and instead uses the APM query result as the scaling count.

integration_type.name: Autoscaler Strategy
integration_type.description: Strategy plugins compare the current state of the system against the desired state defined by the operator in a scaling policy. In practical terms, strategies receive the current value and a metric value for a resource and output what the new value should be.

integrations.name: Nomad Task Group Target
integrations.description: The Nomad task group target indicates the scalable resource is a Nomad job running on a Nomad cluster.

integration_type.name: Autoscaler Target
integration_type.description: Target plugins determine where the resource to be autoscaled is located and execute the scaling actions determined by the Autoscaler. The target can be a Nomad job group (horizontal application scaling), the number of Nomad clients (horizontal cluster scaling), or the amount of resources assigned to a Nomad task (vertical application scaling).

integrations.name: Rkt Driver
integrations.description: Nomad 0.11 converted the rkt driver to an external driver.

integrations.name: Dynamic Application Sizing Nomad Task Target
integrations.description: The app-sizing-nomad target plugin reports on the current task resource value as well as submits recommendations to Nomad via the recommendations API endpoint based on the result of the Dynamic Application Sizing strategy calculations.

integration_type.name: Device Plugin
integration_type.description: Device plugins are used to detect and make devices available to tasks in Nomad. Devices are physical hardware that exists on a client node such as a GPU or an FPGA.
